cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, forecast to skirt the north coast of Cuba Thursday night–Friday, enter the eastern Gulf of Mexico Saturday, and curve northwest toward the Florida Panhandle by Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (likely near or east of Pensacola / Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti (northern coast), Turks and Caicos, southeastern Bahamas, and several Cuban provinces
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic south coast from Punta Palenque eastward and north coast east of the DR/Haiti border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, Turks and Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba, South and West Florida Peninsula, Florida Keys, eastern Gulf Coast, Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (25–40 mph) possible late Saturday through Sunday as the center passes in the eastern Gulf
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along Tampa Bay and lower Manatee County shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally higher totals; flooding of low-lying and poorly drained areas is possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas, rip currents, and occasional lightning in squalls that could disrupt port operations
